programme.desc: Musical biopic of 1920s singer and comedienne Fanny Brice, who rose from poor beginnings in New York's slums to become an overnight star and the toast of Broadway. Her success, however, came at the price of a turbulent private life and an unhappy marriage to a gambler, who grew increasingly jealous of her fame. Starring an Oscar-winning Barbra Streisand, with Omar Sharif, Kay Medford and Walter Pidgeon.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker.

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: In the months leading up to the Second World War, a young London stockbroker attempts to rescue hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia. Fifty years later he comes to terms with the guilt and grief he carried with him for decades. Drama based on a true story, starring Anthony Hopkins, Lena Olin and Johnny Flynn.

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: Musical biopic of 1920s singer and comedienne Fanny Brice, who rose from poor beginnings in New York's slums to become an overnight star and the toast of Broadway. Her success, however, came at the price of a turbulent private life and an unhappy marriage to a gambler, who grew increasingly jealous of her fame. Starring an Oscar-winning Barbra Streisand, with Omar Sharif, Kay Medford and Walter Pidgeon.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: Quadrophenia
programme.desc: A teenager in 1960s London is unhappy with his lot in life, but believes he has found a place to belong in the mod subculture and their feud with the rival rockers. But bit by bit, his naive vision of the world is cruelly shattered. Drama based on the Who album, starring Phil Daniels, Leslie Ash, Sting and Ray Winstone.

programme.title: Holiday Inn
programme.desc: A song-and-dance man tires of the bright lights and retires to a farm, but boredom soon prompts him to dream up an ambitious plan for the place. Musical, featuring the classic song White Christmas, starring Bing Crosby, Fred Astaire and Virginia Dale.

programme.title: My First Summer
programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: An Army officer is accused of murdering a bartender, whom he claims he killed because the man raped his wife. He turns to a tenacious lawyer to get him off the hook, but the attorney faces a challenge because the prosecution alleges the defendant killed the barman because he was having an affair with his wife. Otto Preminger's courtroom drama, starring James Stewart, Ben Gazzara, Lee Remick and Eve Arden.

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: A self-centred jazz trumpeter's single-minded ambition alienates everyone who cares about him. Spike Lee's drama, with Denzel Washington, Wesley Snipes, Joie Lee, John Turturro and the director himself.

programme.title: Holiday Inn
programme.desc: A song-and-dance man tires of the bright lights and retires to a farm, but boredom soon prompts him to dream up an ambitious plan for the place. Musical, featuring the classic song White Christmas, starring Bing Crosby, Fred Astaire and Virginia Dale.

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.

programme.title: Gorillas in the Mist
programme.desc: American zoologist Dian Fossey gives up her comfortable city life to research endangered mountain gorillas in Rwanda. Living among the apes, she develops a close bond with the animals and becomes an expert in how they communicate, while dedicating the rest of her life to protecting gorillas from extinction. Fact-based drama, starring Sigourney Weaver, Bryan Brown, Julie Harris and Iain Cuthbertson.

programme.title: Sundown
programme.desc: Neil and Alice Bennett are the core of a wealthy family on holiday in Mexico, until a distant emergency cuts their trip short. When one relative disrupts the family's tight-knit order, simmering tensions rise to the fore. Drama, starring Tim Roth, Albertine Kotting McMillan and Samuel Bottomley.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: An Army officer is accused of murdering a bartender, whom he claims he killed because the man raped his wife. He turns to a tenacious lawyer to get him off the hook, but the attorney faces a challenge because the prosecution alleges the defendant killed the barman because he was having an affair with his wife. Otto Preminger's courtroom drama, starring James Stewart, Ben Gazzara, Lee Remick and Eve Arden.

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: A self-centred jazz trumpeter's single-minded ambition alienates everyone who cares about him. Spike Lee's drama, with Denzel Washington, Wesley Snipes, Joie Lee, John Turturro and the director himself.

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.(n)

Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy, Artie decides to secretly escape his Northern Ireland care home, and embarks on a journey to France to pay his final respects to his best friend. Drama, starring Pierce Brosnan and Jurgen Prochnow.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: The Hanging Sun
programme.desc: Fleeing from his ex-employer, John, a reluctant assassin, seeks refuge in an isolated village, where he is faced with events that test his conscience. Drama based on the Jo Nesbo novel, starring Alessandro Borghi, Jessica Brown Findlay, Peter Mullan and Charles Dance.(n)

programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy, Artie decides to secretly escape his Northern Ireland care home, and embarks on a journey to France to pay his final respects to his best friend. Drama, starring Pierce Brosnan and Jurgen Prochnow.(n)

programme.title: Wildhood
programme.desc: After discovering that their mother could still be alive, two lads make a run for a better life, finding community, identity and love along the way. Drama, starring Steve Lund and Michael Greyeyes.(n)

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef.(n)

programme.title: Cuckoo
programme.desc: A 17-year-old moves with her family to a resort where things are not what they seem. Writer/director Tilman Slinger's horror thriller, starring Hunter Schafer, Jan Bluthardt and Dan Stevens.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Family Favourites
programme.desc: Discover some of the very best Sky Originals to watch with the whole family, from Monster Family to The Amazing Maurice.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Between the Temples
programme.desc: A cantor in a crisis of faith has his world turned upside down when his school music teacher re-enters his life as his new adult bat mitzvah student. Comedy, starring Jason Schwartzman, Carol Kane and Dolly De Leon.(n)

programme.title: Touch
programme.desc: A man embarks on an emotional journey to find his first love who disappeared 50 years ago. Icelandic romantic drama, starring Egill Olafsson, Koki and Palmi Kormakur. In English, Japanese and Icelandic.(n)

programme.title: Greedy People
programme.desc: A rookie cop is partnered with an unhinged and morally dubious local officer in a small island town. A murder and the discovery of a million dollars soon turns the local community's lives upside down. Director Potsy Ponciroli's comedy, starring Himesh Patel, Lily James and Joseph Gordon-Levitt.(n)

programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills.(n)

programme.title: Pompeii
programme.desc: Kit Harington plays a gladiator battling to save his true love as Mount Vesuvius causes devastation in Pompeii. Action with Kiefer Sutherland.

programme.title: The War Of The Worlds
programme.desc: HG Wells' classic sci-fi yarn sees Martians landing on Earth and toasting the planet with heat rays. A scientist works desperately to find their weakness.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Spectacular...
programme.desc: Reach beyond the stars and discover new worlds as we take a spectacular journey through some of our favourite Sci-Fi movies, from Blade Runner to Star Trek 5: The Final Frontier.

programme.title: Silent Running
programme.desc: Douglas Trumbull's cult sci-fi drama stars Bruce Dern as a botanist charged with looking after Earth's last remaining plant life. Flashing images/mono sound only.

programme.title: Concrete Utopia
programme.desc: Survivors from a massive earthquake struggle for a new life in Seoul, with just one apartment building left standing. South Korean drama with subtitles.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A programmer is chosen to be part of a breakthrough experiment in artificial intelligence. Oscar-winning sci-fi with Domhnall Gleeson, Oscar Isaac and Alicia Vikander.

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: As the legendary monster resurfaces, will he prove to be humanity's unlikely saviour? Blockbuster with Bryan Cranston.

programme.title: World War Z (Extended Cut)
programme.desc: Adaptation of the cult novel with Brad Pitt as a UN advisor searching for the source of a zombie plague. Extended cut is digital version only. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: The Purge
programme.desc: A family are subjected to a night of terror when the government makes all crimes legal for 12 hours. Horror. Language/violence/mature themes/flashing images.

programme.title: Children Of Men
programme.desc: In 2027, humanity faces extinction thanks to worldwide infertility. Can Clive Owen keep a miraculously pregnant woman alive? Sci-fi with Julianne Moore. Strong language.

programme.title: Arrival
programme.desc: When mysterious spacecrafts appear around the world, a linguist works with the military to communicate with the extraterrestrial passengers. Sci-fi drama.

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.desc: Theatrical version of Ridley Scott's classic sci-fi thriller, with Harrison Ford as a troubled cop on the trail of fugitive androids. Based on a novel by Philip K. Dick.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: Romantic fantasy thriller starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz and PenÃ©lope Cruz. After a night of flirtation with the beautiful Sofia, a violent encounter with an obsessive ex-girlfriend leaves playboy David Aames badly disfigured and facing a charge of murder.

programme.title: MaXXXine
programme.desc: In 1980s Hollywood, adult film star and aspiring actress Maxine Minx finally gets her big break. But as a mysterious killer stalks the starlets of Tinseltown, a trail of blood threatens to reveal her sinister past. The third instalment of director Ti West's acclaimed X film series, starring Mia Goth, Lily Collins, Giancarlo Esposito and Kevin Bacon.

programme.title: Monkey Man
programme.desc: Action thriller directed by and starring Dev Patel. A nameless young man known only as Kid makes his living as a masked participant at a seedy underground fight club where he is beaten up regularly. But there is method in his madness, as he works toward exacting revenge against those responsible for his traumatic past.

programme.title: Sweethearts
programme.desc: Two college freshmen break up with their high school sweethearts during one chaotic night before Thanksgiving. Comedy, starring Kiernan Shipka, Nico Hiraga, Christine Taylor and Jason Babinsky.

programme.title: A Sacrifice
programme.desc: US social psychologist Ben Monroe investigates a local cult connected to an unnerving event, while his daughter becomes mixed up with an enigmatic local boy. Co-writer/director Jordan Scott's drama, starring Eric Bana, Sylvia Hoeks and Sadie Sink (Stranger Things).

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview: May 2025
programme.desc: A look ahead to the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Hypnotic
programme.desc: Police detective Danny Rourke is haunted by the abduction of his seven-year-old daughter Minnie from a park. During a bank heist, Danny discovers a photo of his daughter with an instruction to find someone called Dell Rayne. Evidence leads to a psychic Diana Cruz, who introduces the cop to the unseen world of hypnotics - people with the ability to control how we perceive the world. Action thriller

programme.title: The American Society of Magical Negroes
programme.desc: Satirical fantasy comedy starring Justice Smith and David Alan Grier. Genial artist Aren, who is African-American, is struggling to make sense of his place in the world until he's invited to join a secret society dedicated to enhancing the lives of white people. However, Aren's debut mission tests his loyalty when he and his first assignment fall for the same person.

programme.title: Arthur's Whisky
programme.desc: When Joan's husband dies, she discovers he'd invented an anti-aging elixir that literally takes the years off. Sharing it with her friends Linda and Susan, the rejuvenated women waste little time in painting the town red, but they soon realise it's a very different world to the one they remember. Co-writer/director Stephen Cookson's comedy, starring Diane Keaton, Hayley Mills, Patricia Hodge, Lulu

programme.title: Robin and the Hoods
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Darcey Ewart and Naomie Harris. Robin is an 11-year-old girl who plays imaginative games with her friends, the Hoods, on the wooded land near to their homes. They engage in pretend battles against rival gangs, but a greater challenge emerges when a property developer, "Clipboard", threatens to transform their kingdom into a leisure facility.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: High school outcasts Janis Sarkisian and Damian Hubbard narrate the tale of 15-year-old Cady Heron, who moves back to America from Kenya with her mother. Janis encourages Cady to infiltrate the Plastics, ruled by the formidable Regina George, but when she does, the clique soon corrupts the new girl. Musical adaptation of the 2004 cult classic, starring Angourie Rice, Renee Rapp, Auli'i Cravalho, a

programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventur

programme.title: Jackie Chan's The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Jackie Chan and Jennifer Love Hewitt. New York City limo driver Jimmy Tong finds himself thrust into the world of international espionage when he dons a hi-tech tuxedo belonging to his secret-agent boss.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. Fantasy adventure based on the DC Comics creation, starring Xolo MaridueÃ±a and Bruna Marquezine.

Writer/director Larry Yang's action drama, starring Jackie Chan, Liu Haocun and Kevin Guo. In Mandarin, with subtitles.

programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Iro

However, his discovery of drifting, a new style of racing reliant on the use of oversteering, soon gets him into more trouble.

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life
programme.desc: Comedy thriller starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence. When a figure from the past returns and targets detective Mike Lowery for assassination, he and partner Marcus Burnett are forced to fight back - curtailing Burnett's retirement plans. But things aren't all they seem, and it gradually becomes clear that Lowery may have an even deeper connection with their assailant.

programme.title: Bad Boys: Ride Or Die
programme.desc: Fugitives from the law they swore to protect, Miami cops Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett run a gauntlet of duplicitous police officers and gun-toting criminals in an attempt to clear their late captain's name. Fourth chapter in the action adventure franchise, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Vanessa Hudgens and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Paul Walker. Disgraced cop Brian O'Conner is given the chance to redeem himself by going under cover to entrap a powerful Miami drugs baron.

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
programme.desc: Action thriller sequel starring Lucas Black. To avoid jail for illegal street racing, a bad-boy teenager is sent to Japan to stay with his estranged father. However, his discovery of drifting, a new style of racing reliant on the use of oversteering, soon gets him into more trouble.

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: Western directed by Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jamie Foxx, Samuel L Jackson and Christoph Waltz. After being freed from slavery and trained in the ways of a bounty hunter by Dr King Schultz, Django sets out to free his wife from a vicious plantation owner.

programme.title: Monkey Man
programme.desc: Action thriller directed by and starring Dev Patel. A nameless young man known only as Kid makes his living as a masked participant at a seedy underground fight club where he is beaten up regularly. But there is method in his madness, as he works toward exacting revenge against those responsible for his traumatic past.

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: Road movie starring Jamie Flatters and Keenan Munn-Francis. Outgoing London teen Nathan stumbles across his shy school friend Sam being mugged and leaps in to save him. Discovering that they are both planning to travel north, Sam offers Nathan a seat in his car.

programme.title: Please Don't Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain
programme.desc: Directionless twenty something Ben Patterson lives with pals John and Martin. All three work at the Trout Plus outdoor goods emporium run by Ben's overbearing father, Farley. A random social media post intimates that an old compass, which Ben, John and Martin found as children, could be the missing link to discovering a bust of Marie Antoinette worth an estimated 100million US dollars. Ben resolve

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: Lao Luo is a washed-up stuntman with a deformed horse called Red Hare, who he saved from euthanasia. The duo become overnight sensations when a fight with debt collectors goes viral. Writer/director Larry Yang's action drama, starring Jackie Chan, Liu Haocun and Kevin Guo. In Mandarin, with subtitles.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as 'Beekeepers', he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Iro

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Paul Walker and Vin Diesel. When illegal street racer Dominic Toretto is suspected of being the mastermind behind a series of truck hijacks, undercover police officer Brian O'Conner is sent to infiltrate his gang. But O'Conner's judgement becomes clouded when he falls in love with Toretto's sister, Mia.

programme.desc: Ersatz kryptonite laced with tobacco tar splits Superman (Christopher Reeve) in two: good Clark Kent and bad Man of Steel.

programme.desc: In a fractured near-future America balanced on the razor's edge, a group of journalists must race through battlefields to reach the White House before D.C. falls.

programme.desc: Everything goes to hell for newly pregnant Belinda after her mother-in-law moves in. As the diabolical guest tries to get her claws on the child, Belinda must draw the line somewhere.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: When an unmanned locomotive roars out of control, two railroad employees (Denzel Washington, Chris Pine) must find a way to bring it to a halt before it crashes and spills its toxic cargo.

programme.title: I Saw the TV Glow
programme.desc: A classmate introduces teenage Owen to a mysterious late-night TV show -- a vision of a supernatural world beneath their own. In the pale glow of the television, Owen's view of reality begins to crack.

programme.title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
programme.desc: A fatherless teen starts to insinuate himself into the life of a renowned surgeon, his wife and two children. The full scope of his intent soon becomes menacingly clear when he confronts the doctor with a long-forgotten transgression.

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: Trapped on an isolated farm, Pearl must tend to her ailing father under the watch of her mother. Lusting for the glamorous life she's seen in movies, Pearl's temptations and repressions collide.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: An outrageous British woman (RenÃ©e Zellweger) decides to take control of her life, but instead falls for two very different men (Colin Firth, Hugh Grant).

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: A sudden attack by Wulf, a ruthless Dunlending lord, forces Helm Hammerhand and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg. Finding herself in a desperate situation, Helm's daughter must lead the resistance.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: Mystic Pizza
programme.desc: Three teenage girls (Julia Roberts, Annabeth Gish, Lili Taylor) come of age one summer working in a pizza parlor in Mystic, Conn.

programme.title: Tuesday
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter must confront Death when it arrives in the form of an astonishing talking bird.

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: A doctor's invention allows a couple (Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet) to erase the memories of their tumultuous relationship.

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Victor Sullivan recruits Nathan Drake to help him recover a 500-year-old fortune. What starts out as a heist becomes a globe-trotting, white-knuckle race to reach the prize before the ruthless Santiago Moncada can get his hands on it.

programme.title: Chronicle
programme.desc: Three high-school friends make a discovery that gives them incredible superpowers, but their lives spin out of control when their darker sides begin to emerge.

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: A genetically engineered soldier (Channing Tatum) informs an ordinary woman (Mila Kunis) of her destiny as the next recipient of an extraordinary inheritance that could alter the balance of the cosmos.

programme.title: Knox Goes Away
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a rapidly evolving form of dementia, a contract killer gets the chance to redeem himself by saving the life of his estranged son.

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: To avoid being beaten up, a young man (Ice Cube) goes to live with his uncle, who just won the lottery.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A lethal CIA agent (Dwayne Johnson) and his former classmate (Kevin Hart) encounter shootouts, espionage and double-crosses while trying to save the U.S. spy satellite system.

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: Two LAPD officers deal with marriage, love and fatherhood amid the harsh realities on the streets of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Skate Kitchen
programme.desc: Camille's life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a group of girl skateboarders. As she journeys deeper into this raw New York City subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship.

programme.title: A Haunted House
programme.desc: Determined not to let a demon ruin his sex life, a man (Marlon Wayans) hires a priest, ghost busters and others to banish an evil spirit from his possessed girlfriend (Essence Atkins).

programme.title: A Haunted House 2
programme.desc: Malcolm (Marlon Wayans) once again finds himself the target of supernatural shenanigans after he, his new girlfriend (Jaime Pressly), and his girlfriend's children move into their dream home.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.

programme.title: Flow
programme.desc: Cat is a solitary animal, but as its home is devastated by a great flood, he finds refuge on a boat populated by various species, and will have to team up with them despite their differences.

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: Armed with proton packs, four paranormal investigators (Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis) battle mischievous ghouls in New York.

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: Now the parapsychologists (Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd) are trying to rid New York of stress-related pink slime.

programme.title: The Dark Money Game
programme.desc: When a political lobbyist is found shot to death, his apparent suicide highlights a bizarre turn in Ohio's largest public corruption case, uncovered by federal investigators that was nearly concealed by loose super PAC campaign financing rules.

programme.desc: Tracing the tangled history of campaign finance back to the creation of the Federal Election Commission (FEC) in 1975, the 2002 McCain-Feingold Campaign Finance Reform Bill, and the Citizens United decision of 2010.
